alert.note: Alert for Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 03 at 1:19PM CST until March 04 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Flint Creek near Kansas affecting Cherokee and Delaware Counties. Kiamichi River near Antlers affecting Pushmataha County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Kiamichi River near Antlers. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, faster flows along the river are expected but no flooding occurs. Interests near the river should continue to monitor later forecasts. Campers near the river should move to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM CST Friday the stage was 20.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.7 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
